availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Thompson (Parke County, Indiana, merchant, attorney, deed commissioner, and court clerk)

body.p: Parke County, Indiana, merchant, attorney, deed commissioner, and court clerk. Virginia native. Son of William Mills Thompson. Married to Sarah M. Thompson. Father of Emeline Thompson and Maggie Thompson. Merchant in Parke County, Indiana, in 1850. Clerk of the Parke County Court in Parke County in 1860. Commissioner of deeds for Kentucky in Parke County in 1860. Attorney in Parke County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Parke County, District 85, p. 339A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Parke County, Rockville, p. 419.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110,Parke County, IN, June 1863, p. 260.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, KY, National 61265, State 1995.
"George Washington Lafayette Thompson (1825-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial 81307969, accessed September 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81307969.
KYR-0001-017-0003.
